resources.string: Weakness, tingling, or burning in arms or legs

The player is not showing immediate symptoms of concussion. However, if in doubt, or if symptoms arise later, please remove the player from the field and seek medical attention.

 The following questions can be used as an additional screening tool for adults and children over 13:
 • At what venue are we today?
 • Which half is it now?
 • Who scored last in this match?
 • What did you play last week?
 • Did your team win the last game?

What should I be watching out for?

 • Direct blow to the head or body
 • Whiplash type movements of the head and neck
 • Player is tackled or collides with another player
 • Player hits the ground

 Skill tips for avoiding concussion injury

 • Lower the height of tacklers and the associated body position of tacklers
 • Change the technique or technical execution of higher, upright tackles so that head contact is avoided or reduced

Concussion is the most commonly diagnosed injury in the community game in England, making 17% of all injuries. There was one diagnosed concussion for a team every 11.4 games in England, although the incidence rates may be higher than this.72% of concussions occurs in the tackle.40% of all concussions are to the ball carrier in the tackle and 32% to the tackler.

Concussion can occur from head contact with the body in a tackle or head contact with the ground. Concussions can occur with no direct head contact.Female Players tend to report more severe and prolonged symptoms. Children tend to recover more slowly from concussive injury.

Concussion must be taken extremely seriously to safeguard the safety and long-term health of players. The majority (80-90%) of concussion symptoms resolve in around 7-10 days, with symptoms resolving within 1-2 days in around a third of cases, although full recovery will normally take longer than this. Loss of consciousness occurs in only 10-15% of concussions.

Headguards, gumshields and other protective equipment do not protect against concussions. Concussion can occur in a game or at training. The onset of the effects of concussion maybe delayed for up to 24–48 hours.
